cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (95 km) southwest of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and head toward the north-western Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast (near the Texas / Louisiana border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for parts of the central Bahamas and eastern Cuba (not Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic, Haiti, southeastern Bahamas and Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, eastern and central Cuba, Florida Keys, and the north-western Gulf Coast later in the period
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions; a small chance (≤7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds Monday into early Tuesday, with higher gusts in squalls
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected, minor coastal water level rises (<2 ft) possible in Biscayne Bay during onshore squalls
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain to South Florida and the Keys Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents on the Atlantic beaches and in the Florida Straits
